newsitem.title: INDIA: India Sandoz 1996/97 1st half net 124.4 mln rupees.
newsitem.headline: India Sandoz 1996/97 1st half net 124.4 mln rupees.

text.p: Sandoz India said it recorded a net profit of 124.4 million rupees for the six months ended September 1996, compared to 68.8 million rupees in the year-ago period.

It said net sales amounted to 1,431.4 million rupees for the six months, up from 1,257.5 million rupees in the year-ago period. Depreciation amounted to 19.0 million rupees (20.7 million rupees in the year ago period) and a tax provision of 85 million rupees (52 million during year-ago period). "Sandoz India expects to maintain good performance in the remainder of the financial period," it said in a statement.

"However, seasonality of some businesses and some expenditure related to the proposed merger between Sandoz India and Hindustan Ciba-Geigy Ltd, does not allow simple extrapolation of figures," it said.
The merger would be subject to approval of local shareholders and the Bombay High Court, it said.
